answerText: IR spectroscopy or infrared spectroscopy[10] This complex section of the IR spectroscopy readout between 500 and 1500 wavenumbers is very hard to read. Its name derives from the fact that this region gives a unique

subject: Science
question: Question: Samples in this technique are dissolved in chloroform and smeared between a pair of salt plates, and anharmonicities can be detected by using the two-dimensional version of this technique. For 10 points each: [10] Identify this form of spectroscopy in which carbonyl groups appear around 1700 wavenumbers and alcohols form a broad peak around 3300 wavenumbers. It uses EM radiation of a longer wavelength than visible light.
